thread.title: Nixon's 'Western White House' estate can be yours for $63M | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Nixon's 'Western White House' estate can be yours for $63M | Daily Mail Online

author: Dailymail.Com Reporters
title: Nixon's 'Western White House' estate can be yours for $63M | Daily Mail Online
text: Richard Nixon's 'Western White House' can be yours for $63MILLION: Palatial home with Pacific Ocean views where former president entertained the Soviet leader and 17 heads of state goes back on the market The 5.45-acre estate in San Clemente, California, was bought by the former Commander in Chief in 1969 Nixon entertained 17 heads of state at the home, which was built in 1926 and overlooks the Pacific Ocean Among his guests were Soviet leader Leonid Brezhnev and Secretary of State Henry Kissinger Nixon moved out of the home in 1980 and sold it to pharmaceutical CEO Gavin S. Herbert Published: 02:56 GMT, 2 February 2017 | Updated: 07:21 GMT, 2 February 2017 104 shares
